text: Psalm 146
Praise to Yahweh for His Help
Praise Yah.\f + \fr 146:1 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f*
Praise Yahweh, O my soul.
I will praise Yahweh while I live;
I will sing praises to my God while I \add am\add* still \add alive\add*.
Do not place trust in princes,
in a son of humankind with whom there is no deliverance.
His breath departs; he returns to his plot;\f + \fr 146:4 \ft A Hebrew wordplay: “humankind,” \fqa adam \ft (v. \xt 3 \ft ), returns to his ground/plot, \fqa adamah \ft  \f*
on that day his plans perish.
Blessed \add is the one\add* whose help \add is\add* the God of Jacob,
whose hope \add is\add* on Yahweh \add as\add* his God,
who made heaven and earth,
the sea and all that \add is\add* in them,
the one who keeps faith\f + \fr 146:6 \ft Or “remains faithful” \f* forever,
\add who\add* executes justice for the oppressed,
\add who\add* gives food for the hungry.
Yahweh sets prisoners free;
Yahweh opens \add the eyes of the\add* blind;
Yahweh raises up \add those\add* bowed down;
Yahweh loves \add the\add* righteous;
Yahweh protects\f + \fr 146:9 \ft Or “watches over” \f* \add the\add* strangers.
He helps up \add the\add* orphan and \add the\add* widow,
but \add the\add* way of \add the\add* wicked he ⸤thwarts⸥.\f + \fr 146:9 \ft Literally “makes crooked” \f*
Yahweh will reign forever,
Your God, O Zion, ⸤throughout all generations⸥.\f + \fr 146:10 \ft Literally “for a generation and a generation” \f*
Praise Yah.\f + \fr 146:10 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f*
